text: Greg. GREG'S POV: we find RODRICK HEFFLEY, an insolent sixteen- year-old, in our face. Rodrick is dressed for school.
Greg!
(half asleep) What? Rodrick shakes Greg awake.

Get up, you’re going to be late. END POV to find GREG HEFFLEY in his twin bed. Greg is ele or twelve, average height, and really thin. Rodrick is go to town with the shaking thing, basically bouncing him on bed.
(fighting him off) Quit it, Rodrick! Why are you -- what am I late for?
Middle school, what do you think? Today's your first day. Hurry up or Mom’s gonna lose it. Rodrick exits. Greg sighs.

Greg, now dressed and ready for school, eats cereal and r the comics with bleary eyes. He turns the kitchen TV on t AN INFOMERCIAL FOR A JUICER. He changes the channel, it’s INFOMERCIAL FOR BUYING FORECLOSURES. He keeps changing channels -- it’s all infomercials. Something’s not right. (CONTINUED)
DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 2.
What are you doing? Greg looks up. FRANK HEFFLEY, Greg’s dad, is there, weari a t-shirt and boxers. He mutes the TV.
Getting ready for my first day of middle... Greg trails off as he looks out a window. IT’S DARK.
From across the street we see the Greg’s house in the dar An owl perches on a tree limb in the foreground.
On Greg and Frank.
.-.school.

It’s four o’clock in the morning. School doesn’t start until next week. SUSAN HEFFLEY, Greg’s mom, unhappily enters. She’s an attractive, harried mom. Frank watches MANNY, their wide- awake two-year-old son, scurry past her, grab the cereal and start eating out of it. FRANK (CONT’D) (sadly) You woke Manny up. He never goes back to sleep. (to Susan) He woke Manny up.
Have you lost your mind?

It was Rodrick!  DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 3. INT. RODRICK’S ROOM —- MOMENTS LATER They all stand in the doorway and look at Rodrick, sound asleep BUT NOW IN HIS PAJAMAS, snoring softly in his bed.
But he --
Go to bed. As they leave, Greg turns back to look at Rodrick, who is the same position only now he’s smiling.

Tight On a closed book. The cover reads ‘Diary’. Pull bac to reveal GREG HEFFLEY is holding the book and directly addressing the camera. Behind him is a WHITE BACKGROUND. Greg is a grown-up trapped in a kid’s body. He has a very matter of fact, casual manner about him -- a worldly, confident attitude. Even so, he remains a likeable boy because we know his bravura just masks normal insecurity. He’s Bill Murray as a kid.

Okay, first of all, let me get something straight: this is a JOURNAL, not a diary. (beat) Right, I know what it says on the cover, but when mom went out to buy this thing I TOLD her not to get me a book that said “diary” on it. This just proves Mom doesn’t know anything. If I walk into my first day of middle school carrying this book around, I might as well be wearing a sign that says “punch me”! INSERT SHOT: The cartoon drawing FROM THE BOOK of THE BUL DISCOVERING GREG'S DIARY. The drawing becomes animated: t Bully punches Greg, sending him and the “diary” flying.
Wimp!  10 11 DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 4. BACK ON GREG addressing the camera. 9

The only reason I agreed to write in this thing is because one day when I’m rich and famous I’1l have better things to do than answer peoples’ stupid questions all day long, and this book is gonna come in handy. INSERT SHOT: The cartoon drawing FROM THE BOOK of Greg at press conference. The drawing becomes animated as reporte shout questions at Greg.
Gregory! Tell us about your childhood!
Were you always so smart and handsome? Greg waves his journal at them.
Here's my journal. Now shoo, shoo. BACK TO GREG addressing the camera. 11

I actually should have started keeping a diary -- I mean journal! -- years ago. Now there’s gonna be this big gap from birth to middle school. (beat) Anyway, I think future generations will be glad I kept a record of this time in my life, but the truth is when they make a movie or a TV mini-series about me, they’1ll probably just skip over the middle school years and go right to the part where I’m famous. (beat) Seriously, who’s gonna want to see a movie about a guy who’s stuck in middle school with a bunch of half- grown morons? He tosses the book on a nearby side table. ZOOM IN TIGHT THE BOOK AND HOLD.

12 13 DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 5. INT. GREG’S BEDROOOM - MORNING 12 Still tight on the book, PULL BACK TO REVEAL the diary is Greg's bedside table, and he is asleep in the bed. SUPER: “September. Tuesday.” Susan, holding Manny, pokes her head in.
Get up, get up, it’s your first day of middle school! Greg stirs and opens his eyes. Suspicious, he checks the window for daylight to make sure it’s legit this time. It is.

Greg, Rodrick, Manny, and Susan eat breakfast. Rodrick is working on a pile of flyers for his band Loded Diaper. Th flyers feature a picture of Rodrick and his bandmates holding instruments and trying their hardest not to look like suburban teenagers. Rodrick is adding devil horns to the “L” in Loded and chuckling.

Mom's always saying I need to gain weight. But if you had to eat with my family, you wouldn’t have much of an appetite either. Pan around the table -- Susan picks her teeth, Rodrick ch his nails. Settle on Manny, who eats his cereal while sitting on a small training potty. Frank passes through o his way out to work, looks at Manny.
The toilet at the table, that doesn’t feel right.
I don’t want him to think it’s shameful.
It should be a little shameful. He grabs a piece of toast and kisses Susan.
See you. (CONTINUED)
13 DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 6.
He exits. 13
(to Greg) So, middle school. You nervous?
(shrugs ) Nah.
Rodrick, give Greg some tips about middle school so he knows what to expect.
(to Greg) It’s like prison. Don’t ever look anyone in the eye, but don’t look down either -- always be looking away, like you're lost in thought. He looks at Greg skeptically.
I’m wasting my time, you'll be dead or home-schooled by the end of the year.
No way.
Not helpful, Rodrick.
You're right. I’m sure he’1ll do great. He’1ll probably be Most Popular in the yearbook. Rodrick grabs his flyers, gets up to leave. He stops and turns around. He exits.
Oh, and one more thing...watch out for the cheese. Susan and Greg look at each other.
Okay, get Manny cleaned up and I’1l drive you to school. Manny looks at Greg, then dumps his cereal in his potty. (CONTINUED)
13 14 15 16 DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 7.
He did that on purpose! I’m not cleaning it up.
It’s your fault he’s still potty training.
Greg, bored, perches on the vanity and watches Manny sit the toilet.
Don’t look down, Manny. The Potty Monster doesn’t like it when you look at him. Manny slowly looks down into the potty --
(covers his mouth) Rrrhaaaaaarrrrrr! MANNY SCREAMS, jumps off the potty and runs out. END FLASHBACK.

Greg chuckles to himself at the memory. Susan looks at hi sternly. Greg gets to work and unhappily dumps out the po into the sink. INT. SUSAN’S CAR - MORNING 16 SUPER: “First Day of School.” Susan stops in front of Whitmore Middle School in her old Honda. Greg looks out the window at students streaming inside. We see Susan wants badly for Greg to do okay here
Want me to walk you in?
No thanks. A beat; Greg just sits there. (CONTINUED)
16 17 18 DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 8.
Are you going to get out?
Yeah. He doesn’t move.
Do you want me to walk you in?
No. Greg hops out. Susan watches him head toward the school.
It’s quiet as Greg nears the large metal front door. The school looks idyllic and nonthreatening. Next to the door a cartoon poster of a character named “Wacky Dawg” welcom new students.
Everybody's always saying how middle school is such a big deal. But to be honest with you, I wasn’t really sweating it all that much. He opens the door and is BLASTED BY A WALL OF NOISE.
Greg stands in the hallway. All around him is mayhem; it’ loud and packed with kids roughhousing and jostling and shrieking. Greg begins to walk down the hall.

Okay, so I admit middle school was way different than what I was expecting. I mean, you got kids like me who haven't hit their growth spurt yet mixed in with these gorillas who need to shave twice a day. GREG'S POV: EXTREME CLOSE-UPS of one big kid’s BUSHY UPPE LIP FACIAL HAIR; another big kid’s FREAKISHLY HAIRY AND MUSCLED FOREARM; another big kid’s shirt open at the neck reveal A TUFT OF YET MORE HAIR.
And not just their faces. (CONTINUED)
DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 9.
A hulking boy with acne, PRESTON, catches Greg’s eye.
Hey, Greg.
Hey... Greg squints at him, puzzled; he has no idea who it is.
..-fella.
Half of these kids were in my school last year, but I could hardly recognize them.

Side by side, we see before and after photos of several o Greg’s schoolmates. The “befores” are normal, cute grade school students. The “afters” look like bizarre hormone experiments. The first photo is of Preston, in which his clear grade school complexion becomes riddled with acne. the ones that follow, full shiny hair becomes lank and greasy; others are stuck in weird, awkward phases of thei growth spurts. In the last “before and after”, A SMALL, NORMAL-LOOKING KID HASN’T CHANGED AT ALL.
Okay, so there were still a few normal looking people like me, but trust me, we were in the minority.
Greg continues to move through the hall, three older guys approach him. The BIGGEST GUY steps in his path.
You new?
Yeah.
Newbie! (CONTINUED)
20 21 22 DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 10.
He punches Greg hard in the arm, his buddies laugh.
Greg rubs his arm at his homeroom desk as ROWLEY JEFFERSO enters behind a couple of other kids. Only his face is visible at this point.
(calls) Hey, Rowley.

Rowley Jefferson is my best friend. The two other kids part and we get our first good look at Rowley. The word for Rowley is “thick”. His head, neck, torso, and legs sit atop one another like a stack of bloc He has a heartbreakingly open, honest, sweet face. HE IS ALSO WEARING A BRIGHTLY COLORED SERAPE. Greg cringes when sees Rowley’s nerdy outerwear.
But that’s definitely subject to change. Rowley sees Greg and becomes excited, waving frantically.
(way too loud) Greg! Greg! Greg! As Rowley heads over to Greg, Greg notices some of the ot kids snickering at Rowley.
What are you wearing?
We just got back from Guatemala. (with a flourish) It’s my serape! Greg slouches in his seat as Rowley spins to show it off.
Greg, Rowley and the rest of the P.E. class wear gym clot Alarmed, Greg watches the large MUSCLED KID next to him s a ball from one hand to the other as COACH MALONE talks. (CONTINUED)
22 23 24 DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 11.
Today you're going to learn how to play dodgeball right. First off, no aiming for the head.
(raises his hand) What happens to us if we hit somebody in the head?
Nothing. Okay now, listen up, when I blow the whistle that means... Coach Malone continues to talk as...

Don’t ask me what genius came up with the idea of dodgeball. My parents spent a lot of money on my braces so I’m pretty sure they didn’t want me to get my teeth rearranged by some moron chucking a rubber ball at ninety miles an hour.
Greg gets hit in the mouth with a dodgeball thrown by a MORONIC GOON. His teeth fly everywhere.
Greg’s hand shoots up.
Uh, I have a heart murmur. My doctor says I can’t play dodgeball.
Okay, well...just go sit over there. He points to the edge of the sport court. Rowley watches Greg go and raises his hand.
I have...asthma.
Do you have an inhaler? (CONTINUED)
24 DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 12.
What?
An inhaler.
Huh?
Where’s your inhaler?
Where?
(sighs) Go sit next to the other guy. Rowley runs off and catches up to Greg. As they walk...
The people running this place are trying to kill us. Maybe this is how they’re gonna fix overcrowding in schools.
I gotta get my hands on an inhaler. (points to dodgeball) ‘Cause that’s scary.
I’m not scared, I’m walking away to make a point. This is just barbaric.
Like the Roman gladiators. Greg and Rowley notice that ANGIE STEADMAN, an intense gi dressed all in black, has fallen in next to them.
Gladiators were actually slaves that were forced to fight to the death just for people’s entertainment.
Really? Greg shoots Rowley a look that says “don’t engage”. (CONTINUED)
24 DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 13.

I’m glad somebody around here finally sees the parallel. (then) I’m Angie. This is my second year, and I’m telling you, middle school is nothing but a bad joke. Through the following, Greg gets increasingly annoyed by Rowley’s attention to Angie.

And the crazy thing is, all the adults know it, but they keep it to themselves. I mean, you hear them talk all the time about how fun high school was and how cute they were in elementary school. But you never, ever hear them saying they wish they could be back in middle school. They never mention it at all.
(locked in) That’s true. Greg pulls Rowley away...
(to Angie) I think the girls are supposed to be over there. As they move off...

Rowley, you gotta stay away from the nutsos. We’re projecting an image here, it’s a very delicate time. They continue toward an empty spot on the blacktop, looki over their shoulders at the dodgeball game. They watch CHIRAG GUPTA, a little Indian boy, get nailed by four bal at once. Greg turns away just in time to see AN OLD GROSS SLICE OF CHEESE right in front of them.
Whoa. Check it out.
Is that...cheese? CLOSE ON THE CHEESE. FOREBODING MUSIC STING. (CONTINUED)
DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 14.
Greg squats down next to it. It’s a slice of cheddar, del cut. He reaches out with his finger, and is about to touc it --
Stop! Alarmed, Greg and Rowley turn to see Chirag run up, battl wounded and out of breath.
What, Chirag?
You almost got the Cheese Touch.
The what? Chirag takes a deep breath, and then begins speaking almo mystically...

A long time ago -- no one knows how long -- that cheese just appeared on the blacktop. No one ever threw it away, and so there it sat, growing more foul by the day. Then one day, a kid -- some say his name was Bernard -- made the biggest mistake of his life.
BERNARD, a curious kid, squats over the cheese and innoce touches it with his finger. Another kid (KID #1) sees him do it and points.
Bernard touched the cheese! Bernard touched the cheese! A crowd of kids runs over pointing and screaming as if th see a zombie.
From that day on, Bernard had the Cheese Touch. END FLASHBACK.  26 27 28 DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 15.
Chirag continues his tale...

No one would go near Bernard because if they touched him, they would get the Cheese Touch. Bernard became an outcast. Until, that is, he was able to pass the Cheese Touch onto an unsuspecting foreign exchange student.

DIETER, a happy looking German foreign exchange student, talks to a group of kids. Bernard sneaks up to the edge o the circle and touches Dieter on the shoulder. The other kids recoil from a confused Dieter.
Was soll das? One kid (KID #2) points at him in horror.
Cheese touch!

And so it went, from student to student, from year to year. As Chirag speaks, we see a ROGUE’S GALLERY OF CHEESE TOUC VICTIMS through the years. Most are boys, but some are unhappy looking girls. END FLASHBACK.
As Greg and Rowley listen to Chirag...
The reign of terror ended when Abe Hall got it five years ago. He moved to California and took the Cheese Touch with him.
29 30 31 DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 16.
A group of solemn kids watch a station wagon pull away. W see ABE, a haunted looking boy, peering out the back wind his hands pressing against the glass. END FLASHBACK.
Chirag looks at them dolefully.
And so today, the cheese sits, patiently waiting for a new victim.
(blown away) Wow.
This is a terrible place. Greg and Rowley look at the cheese. When they look up, CHIRAG IS GONE. Coach Malone blows his whistle, signallin the end of P.E.
Maybe we should just throw it away. Rowley starts to reach for the cheese -- Greg quickly hol him back.
Geez, Rowley!
The cafeteria is just as loud and untamed as the rest of school -- there’s yelling, pushing, maybe some food flyin places. Greg and Rowley move through the lunch line, push their trays.
By the way, second floor bathroom? No stall doors. I learned that the hard way.
What? If there’s no doors people can see you. And all your business. (CONTINUED)
31 32 33 DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 17.

Yeah, well, worse than them seeing you is you seeing them. Trust me, you don’t want to lock eyes with some strange guy sitting on a toilet. It’s a weird feeling. Rowley shudders. The lunch lady hands Greg a plate of yellow, lumpy goop (chicken a la king). He and Rowley hea toward the table area. They see a few empty seats at a table of kids. Greg start to put his tray down.
That seat’s saved.
For who?
It’s saved. Greg moves toward another empty seat at the table.
That seat’s saved. Greg moves to the last empty seat. He looks at the kid wh just shakes his head. Greg looks around at the others at table; they ignore him and Rowley as if they don’t exist.
Greg decides to try his luck with some shaggy looking skateboard kids. He crosses to their table, but they take one look at him and Rowley:
No way.
Greg and Rowley approach a table full of girls.
Forget it. Rowley turns to Greg.
So where are we supposed to eat?  34 35 DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 18.

Greg and Rowley have found a couple of lonely chairs in t corner and awkwardly try to eat with their lunch trays on their laps. FREGLEY, a thin hyper kid who breathes throug his teeth in a way that often makes a whistling sound, approaches with a lunch tray.
Hey Greg Heffley. Want to see my secret freckle?

No thanks, Fregley. Fregley sits down on the floor next to them. Greg tries t cut his chicken, but without a table it’s hard to do and chicken goes flying off of his plate and plops on the flo near Fregley. They all look at it.
Are you going to finish that?
Kids stream out at the end of the school day. Greg and Rowley are mid-pack.
Okay, the first day wasn’t great, but at least I got out with my dignity. Or so I thought.
(yelling to be heard) Hey Greg, you want to come over and plaayyy?! An older kid, QUENTIN, overhears and steps in front of th
What did you say?
(panicked) ...Flarb.
(to Greg) What'd he say? (CONTINUED)
35 36 37 DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 19.
I don’t know. I don’t even know that guy.
(calls to friends) Hey guys, check it out. Quentin’s two buddies, ARTHUR and JOE, approach.
This guy says to that guy, want to come over and plaayyy? Greg grimaces at Quentin and his friends’ scornful expressions.
This was hard to take, because in twenty years all these mouth-breathers would be working for me.

It’s Greg, the same actor, but with a mustache and wearin short sleeve dress shirt with a tie. He holds a clipboard and watches Quentin, Joe, and Arthur (also with mustaches struggle mightily to put a heavy crate on a high shelf.
We finally got it up there, boss.
That’s a shame. Because now I need you to take it back down, and after that I’m going to need you to put it back up there.
But --
Chop chop!
A WHOLE CROWD OF KIDS are now gathered around Greg and Ro as Quentin finishes gleefully repeating the story for newcomers. (CONTINUED)
DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 20.
(mocking) «..come over and...plaayyy! THEY ALL LAUGH. Greg grabs Rowley and quickly pulls him a from the crowd to a space by the bike rack.
Thanks a lot, Rowley.
What? What’d I do?
We're in middle school now. Nobody plays anymore, they hang out.
What’s the difference?
The difference is we can’t act like kids anymore.
Oh. Okay, got it. ROWLEY NONCHALANTLY GRABS HIS BIG WHEEL which is parked n to a bunch of bikes. Greg looks at the Big Wheel in horro
Rowley. A Big Wheel?
(shrugs ) I like being low to the ground. Rowley takes off on his Big Wheel. Greg follows, consciou of the stares Rowley is attracting.
Rodrick’s van with the name of his band “Loded Diper” scrawled on the side is parked in the driveway. Next to t van is parked Rowley’s Big Wheel.
Greg and Rowley sit on the floor and play a racing video game. Manny sits on his tiny potty next to them and watch Rowley is engrossed in the game, but Greg is clearly distracted. (CONTINUED)
DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 21.

When we got home I tried to unwind, but I couldn’t stop thinking about school. And I’m worried about Rowley. He’1l never be able to figure out how to make it through that place. He lacks nuance. I mean, you can beat him at a video game just by naming your car something ridiculous. On the TV, Greg’s car passes Rowley’s.
Bad Fart ahead!
(falls over laughing) Bwaahahaha! In imitation, Manny laughs and falls off his potty.
Let’s race again. Greg switches off the game. Rowley looks at him questioningly. Manny mimics Rowley and also looks at Greg questioningly.
Rowley, you need to focus. Our first day sucked.
It did? Greg looks at Rowley like, “Is anybody home?”
We’re nobodies at school. I don’t know about you, but I never envisioned myself as the guy who has to eat lunch off his lap. That is okay for Fregley but not me.
My mom told me to just be myself and people would like me.
That would be good advice if you were somebody else.
40 4l DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 22.
Greg opens the front door to Rowley, who consults a book ("How to Make Friends in New Places with Jokes”).
Knock knock!
Huh?
Thermos!
Excuse me?
Thermos be some way to tickle your funny bone!
Say what? END FLASHBACK. INT. HEFFLEY LIVING ROOM —- CONTINUOUS 4l Greg gives Rowley a sideways look. Rowley gets an idea an looks excited. Manny looks excited, too.
I think I may still have that joke book I used when I met you. Maybe I should bring it to school? Greg looks at Rowley sorrowfully.

That book is not your friend. No book is going to help us. A beat while Rowley and Greg think. Rowley screws up his face in concentration and stares at the ceiling. Manny imitates him. Greg gets an idea.
We need to get into Rodrick’s room.
I’m not going in Rodrick’s room. Rowley shakes his head “no”. So does Manny.  42 43 DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 23.

LOUD TERRIBLE MUSIC. Greg and Rowley peek around the corn to see Rodrick play the drums as he rehearses with his cr band. They wince at the noise. INT. RODRICK’S ROOM —- MOMENTS LATER 43 Rodrick’s room is a mess. Posters indicate he’s really in Nine Inch Nails, Tool, and Slipknot. Rowley watches the d nervously as Greg, on his hands and knees, tosses aside j from underneath Rodrick’s bed. A half-eaten candy bar; a ouija board; and A GLOSSY MAGAZINE ENTITLED “MOTO MAMAS”, cover of which features a very buxom model in a thong bik draped promiscuously over a motorcycle. Rowley eyes widen he looks at the magazine.
Wow. I didn’t know Rodrick was into motorcycles. Greg pulls out the WHITMORE MIDDLE SCHOOL YEARBOOK, holds up.
Rodrick’s middle school yearbook. He quickly pages through, finds what he’s looking for.

Right here, Class Favorites. The best in the class. These people are famous. And I guarantee you they always get an actual table at lunch. As Greg looks through the Class Favorites, we go CLOSE ON PICTURES.

This was it. If you can get yourself voted onto the Class Favorites page, you're practically an immortal. Even if you don’t live up to what you get picked for, it doesn’t really matter because it’s on permanent record. Settle on the photo of the “Most Popular” guy, BILL WATSO (CONTINUED)
43 44 45 DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 24.
People still treat Bill Watson like he’s something special even though he dropped out of high school and works at the Food Barn.
Greg and Susan are at the grocery store checkout behind T HIGH SCHOOL GIRLS. An older-looking Bill Watson is the bagger. The girls eye Bill and giggle.
Will that be paper or plastic?
(dreamy ) Whatever you think, Bill. END FLASHBACK. INT. RODRICK’S ROOM - CONTINUOUS 45 Greg points Favorites from the book out to Rowley.
This is where I need to be. Most Popular, Best Dressed, Class Clown...they should just give that to me right now. I’m hilarious. Rowley notices the picture of the “Cutest Couple”.
Hey, maybe we should go for “Cutest Friends”.
You're kidding, right? THE DOOR FLIES OPEN. IT’S RODRICK.
What did I tell you I’d do to you if I caught you in my room again?
You said you’d kill him.
Good answer, Rowley. You can go. (CONTINUED)
45 46 47 48 DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 25.
Rowley sprints out.
I'm sorry, Greg!

Mom and Dad aren’t here. It’s just you and me. And I’m going to really, actually kill you. Greg makes a break for the door. He feints left, then hea right, but Rodrick stays with him blocking the door. Greg jumps up on Rodrick’s bed and grabs the edge of Rodrick’s prized Nine Inch Nails poster and prepares to rip it.
No! Greg starts to rip it; Rodrick lunges for him. Greg jumps around him and runs out the door.
With Rodrick right on his tail, Greg squeaks into his roo He shuts and locks the door behind him, leaving an enrage Rodrick in the hall.
Rodrick beats on the door.

You can’t stay in there forever, Greg! I don’t care how long it takes, I’m going to be right here, waiting to kill you! Greg peeks under his door. FROM GREG’S POV we see Rodrick sneakers. Greg sighs. INT. GREG’S BEDROOM - LATER 48 Greg creeps to the door, peeks underneath it. FROM GREG’S POV we see Rodrick’s sneakers are still there. BAM BAM BA Rodrick bangs on the door. Greg jumps back.
Rodrick, time out, I have to pee.

No time outs!  49 50 51 52 53 DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 26. INT. GREG’S BEDROOM - NIGHT 49 Night has fallen outside Greg’s window. Greg peeks under door; RODRICK’S SNEAKERS ARE STILL THERE. Greg hops from foot to the other; he really has to pee. Desperate, he puts his hand on the doorknob. Takes it off Puts it back on, takes a breath, flings open the door and assumes a fighting stance... But the hallway is empty. What? Greg looks down, revealin RODRICK’S EMPTY SNEAKERS. Greg speeds off to the bathroom INT. BATHROOM —- MOMENTS LATER 50 Greg stands over the toilet and starts to go. Suddenly, Rodrick leaps out from behind the shower curtain.
Raaaaaaaaaaahhhhhhh! !!
Aaaaaaaaaaaaahhhhhh!!! Startled, Greg jumps and twists and WE HEAR THE SOUND OF SPLASHING EVERYWHERE.
Greg scrubs the bathroom floor around the toilet. Susan stands over him.
It’s dark. Time speeds up, the sun rises, revealing the cheese. A little steam comes off it as the day begins.

Greg and Rowley examine the Activity Board that is posted a cork wall. There’s a heading for each activity (Key Clu Swim Team, etc.) with a sign-up sheet underneath. Angie walks up behind them and listens.
You don’t like any of this stuff.
I know, but if I’m gonna be a Class Favorite I have to make a name for myself. (CONTINUED)
DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 27.
Why do you want to be a Class Favorite? Startled, Greg turns around to her.
I didn’t say that.
Yeah, you did.
No, I...what probably happened is somebody yelled it over there and the sound bounced off this wall behind me so it sounded like I said it.
I’ve seen that on Scooby Doo. A beat. Angie looks at them, trying to decide if they’re kidding. She forges ahead.

H looks terrified and is tilting to one side from the weigh his giant backpack which is slung over one shoulder. He rolls slowly, wobbling precariously. He is barely able to stop in time to avoid crashing into the bike rack.
(slo-mo effect) Aaah. END SLO-MO. As Rowley stands by the bike rack, gasping for air.

I don’t want to get ahead of myself, but I will say I did an amazing job of improving Rowley. He was ready to be the friend of a Class Favorite.  113 114 DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 54.
The class is in their seats as Ms. Darnell makes some mor announcements.
..-And finally, there are some spots available on Safety Patrol. If anyone’s interested, see me after homeroom. This gets Greg’s attention.
A SERIES OF QUICK CUTS of Greg as he suits up for Safety Patrol. Orange vest strapped on. Sides of vest cinched. Badge clipped on. Sneaker laces tightened. Sunscreen slapped on.
Greg and his fellow Safety Patrols strut down the hallway SLO MO through a haze of smoke a la The Right Stuff. Greg passes SHELLY AND MARLEY who watch him and giggle.
Greg Heffley has a cute butt.
A full page photo of Greg with his back to us, looking ov his shoulder at the camera. The caption reads “Best Butt”
The class is gone. Greg and Rowley are at Ms. Darnell’s desk. She hands them badges and orange vests.
Okay, you'll be walking the kindergartners home after their half day. (MORE ) (CONTINUED)
117 DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 55.
They go right after lunch, so you'll be excused from the first twenty minutes of sixth period.
But that means we'll miss half of alge- Greg gives Rowley a big pinch.
-- brahooey!
Greg saunters toward the front door of the school with Rowley. They are in their orange plastic Safety Patrol ve and each has a cup of steaming cocoa.
So we enlisted. And get this, because Safety Patrols are outside a lot, we get special, exclusive Safety Patrol cocoa. Greg takes a sip of his cocoa, Collin passes by. Angie is further down the hall.
Wow. Is that cocoa?
(officious) Sorry. Safety Patrols only. Greg continues on, Rowley shoots Collin a rueful look.
Sorry. Angie is annoyed by Greg’s attitude toward Collin.
You might want to ease up a little, Heffley.
Huh?
I mean, it’s just Safety Patrol. In middle school. It’s the lowest of the low. (CONTINUED)
118 DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 56.
I don’t think you understand the seriousness of our job. Greg throws open the front door to reveal Ms. Darnell wai outside with EIGHT LITTLE KINDERGARTEN KIDS.
Okay, these are the kids you’1ll be walking home.
Actually, it’s the lowest of the lowest of the low. Greg glares at her.

SUPER: “December. Wednesday.” Greg and Rowley are at the foot of the elementary school steps with the kindergartners lined up in a row on the sidewalk. Rowley suddenly sees THE PICKUP TRUCK FROM HALLOWEEN almost upon them.

Greg, it’s those guys from Halloween. Greg looks where Rowley is pointing and sees the pickup. EXTREME CLOSE-UPS: Shredded paint on the side of the truc Pete behind the wheel; Wade in the pickup bed with the fi extinguisher. As the truck passes them, PETE SEES GREG. GREG SEES PETE HIM. The truck stops and quickly reverses back to where G and Rowley were standing. BUT NOW IT’S JUST THE KINDERGARTNERS -- NO GREG AND ROWLEY. Pete puts the truck in park and is about to investigate w a CAR HONKS BEHIND them. Wade starts pounding on the back window.
(re: car behind them) Dude, it’s Principal Kinney, go go go! As Pete throws it in drive and speeds away, THE CAMERA MO

head_text.subj: UP AND OVER THE CONFUSED KINDERGARTNERS TO FIND GREG AND
ROWLEY FLAT ON THE GROUND BEHIND THEM.

text: (CONTINUED)
120 121 122 123 DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 57.
That was close.
So close. Rowley looks at Greg a beat then smiles. Greg starts to chuckle. As they laugh together...
Close on the cheese as snow falls on it.
Kids pour out of the school, happy to escape captivity. G stands by the curb, in his Safety Patrol badge and vest. sees some kids step into the street.
Wait for the light, people. Feeling pretty good about himself, Greg turns back toward school AS THE KIDS SHRUG AND CROSS ANYWAY.
There’s just something about a man in uniform. Even a plastic one. Now that I was on Safety Patrol everything was falling into place, I was on the road to Class Favorite.
The house is decorated for Christmas with twinkly lights a wreath on the door.
So I went into Christmas vacation feeling pretty good and ready to enjoy our Heffley family holiday traditions.

Greg, Frank and Rodrick sit on the couch eating pie and watching a BIKINI BEACH MOVIE ON TV. A decorated tree glo behind them. It’s nice, peaceful even. Rodrick notices Manny on the floor going through his backpack.
Manny, get out of my stuff! (CONTINUED)
123 124 DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 58.

Manny slowly turns his head and glares at Rodrick for a b He then walks over and squeezes in on the end of the couc next to them. ANGLE ON the TV, on which two young women in bikinis are bouncily running in slo-motion on the beach. PAN DOWN THE ROW OF HEFFLEY MEN -- First Frank, then Rodr then Greg all with the same enthralled expression. Finall we land on Manny, WHO STARTS TO YELL.
Aaaaah! Aaaaah! Aaaaah! Susan runs in.
What? What’s going on? Then she sees the TV.
What are you watching? Turn that off.
What? Why?
I don’t want Manny exposed to that kind of thing. Women are more than just a place to hang a bikini.
But these women are smart. Tracey and Sabrina are about to solve a dognapping. Susan looks at Frank.
I told them to turn it off. Manny grabs the remote and changes the channel to a CARTO He then turns to Rodrick and smiles.
Greg and Rowley are walking up the hill. Rowley has his B Wheel, Greg has the football. (CONTINUED)
124 125 DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft
I’m thinking when we get back to school, it’s time for me to really make my move. Maybe run for student council. Something easy, like Treasurer.
Isn't that a lot of math?
You could do the math. You could be the man behind the man.
I got a C in math.
Hm. Greg stops, Rowley continues to the top of the hill.
I didn’t know exactly what it was going to be, I just knew I needed my big break. Rowley turns his Big Wheel downhill.
Ready? 59. 124 Rowley takes off down the hill. As Rowley speeds past on Big Wheel, Greg fires a tight spiral directly at him. ball hits Rowley’s front wheel.
Yes! The

head_text.subj: ROWLEY AND THE BIG WHEEL ARE KNOCKED OFF COURSE, HIT A CU

text: AND GO AIRBORNE. Rowley flies through the air, then crash into a snow drift.
Only the way it turned out, the big break wasn’t mine.
SUPER: “January. Monday.” Students trudge into the school. 125  126 DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 60.
Rowley’s left hand is in a cast. He stands at his locker. Reveal Greg a few feet away looking at him sheepishly. He takes a deep breath, crosses to Rowley.
(keeping it light) Hey, that was some ride, Rowley.
Hmm. Shelly and Marley pass by. Shelly notices Rowley’s cast a stops.
Oh my gosh, what happened?
Broke it.
How?
Big Wheel accident. Shelly and Marley laugh.
You’re funny.
Does it still hurt?
I guess.
You poor thing.
Can I sign your cast?

Me, too! Other girls gather around Rowley and push Greg further an further back until he is shoved right out of the crowd. G does not like being stuck on the outside and pushes his w back into the circle. (CONTINUED)
126 127 DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 61.
Hey! Hey! I’m the one who broke his hand. The girls all turn to look at Greg.
Then you're a jerk. The girls turn back to Rowley as Greg slinks away.

Greg, with his lunch tray, heads toward his usual seat at edge of the room when he sees something shocking. Rowley a table with Shelly, Marley and some other popular girls. There are no empty seats. As Greg watches, Shelly feeds Rowley a bite of food. Rowley says something Greg can’t h and the girls laugh. This pushes Greg to his limit.

I couldn't believe it. Rowley was eating at an actual table -- and all because of a stupid broken hand. And he doesn’t even care where he eats. If anyone should be at a table, it’s me. He looks out across the room, at the tables full of unwelcoming kids. His eyes fall on Angie who is sitting a table nearby. There is an empty seat next to her.

I'd ask you to join me, but this table’s for people on the paper, not in the paper. Greg sighs and heads in the other direction, back to his usual place. He stops when sees Fregley is sitting in Rowley’s old seat. But Greg really has no place else to g He glumly sits.
Hey Greg Heffley, want to see me eat my whole sandwich in one bite?

No thanks. But Fregley does it anyway, stuffing his entire sandwich his mouth. He grins and points to his mouth, “See, did it Greg's eyes drift back to Rowley’s table.  128 129 130 DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 62. INT. GREG’S BEDROOM - LATER 128 Greg is on his bed, sketching in his journal. We see a cartoon of Rowley at the lunch table with the girls.
I realized Rowley’s injury thing was a pretty good racket, so I decided it was time for me to have an injury of my own.
Greg throws his backpack in his locker. We see that one a is now wrapped in gauze. He grabs a notebook from his loc and crosses to Shelly and Marley. He thrusts his arm towa the girls.
Hey guys, check it out.
Oh my gosh, what happened?
It’s a raging infection caused by a splinter that was left untreated. The girls just look at him. He holds up his notebook.
Want to be the first to sign my sympathy sheet? The girls wrinkle their noses in disgust and walk away. Fregley approaches.
Can I peek at your infection?
Go away.
The kids are hanging around before homeroom starts. Greg enters, unwrapping the gauze from his hand. As he stuffs in the trash he notices Rowley and Collin talking.
...and on the x-ray you could see where the bone just snapped right in half. (CONTINUED)
DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 63.
Wow. I broke a toe once. It got all purple.
Cool.
Hey Gregory, want to sign the card?
You got Rowley a card?!

What? No. It’s for Bryan Little, you know the guy who does that Wacky Dawg cartoon for the school paper? He has mono and he’s going to be out for three months. Greg notices that a bunch of kids are gathered around the teacher’s desk signing a big posterboard card. The card h a drawing of a dog with a sad face and says “We’re going miss you, Wacky Dawg.”
(suddenly interested) Bryan Little’s sick? So who’s going to do the cartoon?
They're having tryouts. But the important thing is that Bryan get better.
(distracted) Uh-huh.

This was what I'd been waiting for all year. Everyone loves the cartoon guy. I mean, Bryan Little was Class Clown last year because of Wacky Dawg. And I draw cartoons all the time, it’s like my biggest talent. I knew I could take something like this right to the top.
131 132 133 DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 64.
Charlie Rose is interviewing Greg, who looks natty in a t blazer with leather elbow patches.
Let’s talk about how funny you are. What is that Greg Heffley “thing” that we all want but only you have?
It’s three things, Charlie. Charisma. Good looks. Humility.
A full page photo of Greg holding up several school paper cartoons. The caption reads “Class Clown”.
Greg and Rowley sit at the kitchen table drawing cartoons
I decided to go ahead and forgive Rowley for milking the broken hand so hard, and told him he could work on the cartoon with me. Chuckling, Rowley hands Greg a piece of paper.
Here, what about this? Greg looks at it, it’s a series of three cartoons. Each o ends with the punchline “Zoo Wee Mama!”
(excited) Zoo Wee Mama!
It’s the same joke every time.
Yeah. Zoo Wee Mama! Rowley cracks up. (CONTINUED)
DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 65.
We can’t just do the same thing over and over.
We can if it’s Zoo Wee Mama. Greg tosses Rowley’s papers aside.
It needs to be a little more sophisticated. Like mine is about a really dumb guy and he does dumb stuff that’s funny. Greg picks up a pencil...

head_text.subj: THE CARTOON BEGINS TO DRAW ITSELF AS GREG DOES THE VOICES

text: FIRST FRAME: CREIGHTON holds something shaped like a box his hand.

I wonder what is in this cute little box. SECOND FRAME: Creighton has been joined by a kid ina baseball cap (CREIGHTON’S FRIEND). The kid points at Creighton... CREIGHTON’S FRIEND That’s not a box, it’s a brick, you dumb moron!
Oops. I have been trying to open it all day.
The drawing in front of Greg is now finished. Greg looks Rowley, expecting him to laugh at the cartoon.
(unsmiling) Can he say Zoo Wee Mama? (CONTINUED)
135 136 137 DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 66.
Rowley, forget Zoo Wee Mama. This is serious business. Do you want me to be Class Clown or don’t you?
But I like Zoo Wee Mama.
You know what, if you like it so much then you should just go do it yourself. The idea of doing it alone has never occurred to Rowley. thinks about it.
(shrugs ) Okay. See ya. Rowley grabs his cartoons and goes. Greg is clearly surprised by this flash of independence.
SUPER: “February. Wednesday.” It is a bleak, gray rainy day.
Safety Patrol was getting to be a drag because of the weather. But I figured once I got the cartoon, I’d just dump it anyway.
Greg crosses to Rowley who is at his locker.
I forgot my raincoat so I’m gonna need you to walk the kids home today.
I can’t. I can’t get my cast wet. Rowley holds up his broken hand. Greg sighs.
You can borrow my coat. He holds up a bright red slicker.  138 139 140 DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 67.

Greg, wearing Rowley’s coat with the hood up, is hunched against the rain as he herds the kindergartners along the sidewalk. Suddenly, he sees the TEEN’S TRUCK making a tur toward them at the end of the street. He stops cold.

Oh no. Greg frantically looks around for an escape route, but there’s nothing but houses. One of the houses is being renovated; the construction site is deserted. Then he spi it: A CONSTRUCTION DUMPSTER. It’s his only hope. He looks at the truck, which is getting closer. He spins around at the kids.
Okay, listen up! We’re being attacked by space monsters and they’re going to eat us unless we can get into that dumpster! Now follow me if you want to live!
Greg is hoisting terrified kids into the dumpster. Greg looks up to see THE TRUCK STOP AT A STOP SIGN JUST A HALF BLOCK AWAY.

Come on! Move it! lLet’s go! Greg helps what he thinks is the last kid in the dumpster but looks over and sees a one small straggler in a puffy parka wandering off. Greg takes off for the kid. SLO-MO: Greg races across the site to the kid, hoists him over his shoulders like a soldier carrying a fallen comra stagger-runs back to the dumpster, and THROWS THE KID IN.

head_text.subj: WATCH THE KID ARC THROUGH THE AIR AND DISAPPEAR INSIDE TH

text: Greg doesn’t have time to take a breath because THE TRUCK BEARING DOWN ON THEM. He turns around to get into the dumpster himself and is confronted by YET ANOTHER KID HE FORGOT, a big husky one this time.
Greg strains to push the hefty kid into the dumpster. He’ almost got him in, but...it’s too late. The truck is on them...but IT’S NOT THE TEEN’S TRUCK AT ALL. (CONTINUED)
140 141 142 DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 68.
Same color, make, and model, but a lone woman is inside i driving. Phew. He relaxes his grip on the kid who teeters on the edge of the dumpster...

Hey! Hey you! Greg looks over, LETTING GO OF THE KID, WHO FALLS IN. It’ MRS. IRVINE, an older woman standing on her porch in a housecoat, and she doesn’t look happy. Her hair is in curlers under a clear plastic rain bonnet.
(mad) Rowley Jefferson, is that you?
(hiding his face) Yes, Mrs. Irvine. Mrs. Irvine walks toward him. Panicked, Greg turns tail a runs off before she can see his face.

Mrs. Irvine looks inside the dumpster. A dog pile of kids crowded into the dirty dumpster look back up at her. With her curlers under the rain bonnet and her makeup running the rain, she looks a little scary. One BOY KINDERGARTNER clears his throat.
Are you going to eat us?
The kids are watching the principal, MR. WINSKY, making announcements on the closed circuit TV on the wall. He re from papers in front of him like a newscaster.

++.SO to whoever took the lizard out of the science lab and put it in my car, you should know that it was very cold yesterday and the lizard is now in intensive care. Mr. Winsky sets aside that paper and reads another announcement. MR. WINSKY (CONT’D) On a happier note, they’ve selected the new cartoon for the school paper. (CONTINUED)
142 143 DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 69.

A murmur of excitement goes through the class. Greg smile expectantly. MR. WINSKY (CONT’D) The winner is... Greg leans forward in his chair, preparing to stand up an accept congratulations. MR. WINSKY (CONT’D) ..."Zoo Wee Mama” by Rowley Jefferson! Greg is shocked. Everyone claps for Rowley.
I couldn't believe it. But I guess it says a lot about the intelligence level at my school, and it doesn’t make me feel real hopeful about the future of our country.
Greg grimly stands next to Rowley who is being chatted up Shelly and Marley. Rowley is basking in the attention.
Will you put me in your cartoon?
Sure. Heh-heh.
And me too -- ooh, I want to be the one who says Zoo Wee Mama.
Okay. Angie approaches.
Hey, Rowley, congratulations.
Thanks.
You deserve it. I read all the submissions and yours was definitely the best. (to Greg) I read yours, too. (CONTINUED)
143 144 145 DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 70.
Angie crosses away as Bryce passes.
Hey, Rowley.
Hey. (happily, to Greg) Wow, everyone knows me now. It’s like I’m famous. Greg is dead inside.
Mr. Worth addresses the class.
.-+-So why did America send soldiers to England?
Because America rocks!
Well...yes. But in this case it was because Germany had... (writes on board) ...invaded -- Mr. Worth drops his chalk.
Zoo Wee Mama! The whole class cracks up (except for Greg) and Bryce hig fives Rowley.
Well, the failure of the public school system was complete. The way I see it, Rowley and the rest of these bozos deserve each other.
Greg and Rowley are walking down the hall. They pass a do that “MR. WINSKY, PRINCIPAL”. Mr. Winsky sticks his head out; he does not look happy.
Rowley Jefferson? (CONTINUED)
145 146 147 DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 71.
Yes, Principal Winsky?

I need to see you in my office. Rowley shoots Greg a worried look and crosses to Mr. Wins They go in the office and Mr. Winsky shuts the door. Greg looks around to make sure nobody's watching, then crosses the door, peeks in the glass window pane. INT. MR. WINSKY’S OFFICE —- CONTINUOUS 146 Mr. Winsky sits at his desk. Rowley sits in the chair acr from him. He looks very small. We see Greg hovering just outside the door, but Mr. Winsky doesn’t notice him.
I got a call from Mrs. Irvine about what happened with the kindergartners last week. She’s very upset. Rowley looks confused.
Back with Greg outside the door. He looks alarmed. He pee in the window again. From his perspective we see Mr. Wins really laying into Rowley.
.+-you brought dishonor to our school and you disrespected the badge.
I really don’t --
Save it. You're going to apologize to those kids tomorrow and you're suspended from Safety Patrol for a week. Including cocoa. Now get out of here.
Yes sir. Rowley exits Mr. Winsky’s office, joining Greg in the hal
(devastated) I’m suspended for a week. I don’t even know what’s he’s talking about. (CONTINUED)
DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 72.
Rowley trudges to his locker, Greg watches him go.
Rowley, I...
What?
Nothing.
Greg comes home. Susan is there, cooking dinner. She take one look at him and knows something is up.
Are you okay? Greg hesitates a beat, then:
I don’t know, I’m in kind of a tough situation.
Sit. Tell me. Greg and Susan sit at the table.
I know something and if I tell the truth about it, it could hurt somebody.
Namely me, but I kept that part to myself.
Well, I think you can never go wrong being honest. On Greg thinking:
The family is celebrating GRAMPA HEFFLEY’S birthday. Susa sets a cake down in front of Grampa. (CONTINUED)
149 150 151 DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 73.
Make a wish, Grampa!
I wish for chocolate cake next year.
If you're alive next year. Everyone glares at Greg.
Hey, I’m just trying to be realistic. END FLASHBACK.
Susan and Greg continue their talk.

You just have to go with your gut and try to do the right thing, because it’s our choices that make us who we are. Greg nods. Susan kisses Greg and exits. Greg chews over what she has just said. EXT. ELEMENTARY SCHOOL —- MORNING 151 Greg is walking to school. He has dark circles under his eyes and looks glum.

I was up all night tossing and turning about this Rowley situation, but I finally figured out what the right thing to do was. He stops. Reveal Greg is standing across the street from Elementary School. On the steps of the school are Rowley, Mr. Winsky and the kindergarten students.
(to kids) I’m sorry I terrorized you children. The children look at each other, confused.
I decided to let Rowley take one for the team this time. (MORE ) (CONTINUED)
151 152 153 154 DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 74.
Now that he had the cartoon he didn’t even need Safety Patrol anymore. Really, I was probably doing him a favor. Head bowed, Rowley sadly hands Mr. Winsky his badge.
Greg comes in the back door from school wearing his backp Susan turns around from baking something.
How'd it go? Did you do the right thing?
I think so. Susan smiles, proud of him.
Greg is in a booth with Susan. A GIANT HOT FUDGE SUNDAE i placed in front of him.
Dig in. You earned it. Greg takes a bite. It’s sawdust in his mouth.
Rowley is sitting on the front steps. Greg approaches; he notices Rowley steal a sad glance at his safety patrol ge
(glum) Did the kids ask about me?
Uh...no.
Oh. A beat.
So, it’s kind of funny. You know that whole Safety Patrol thing? (CONTINUED)
DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 75.
Yeah?

Well, you remember that day you lent me your jacket? See, I thought I saw those guys from Halloween and so, you know, otherwise I never would've, but... Okay. I’m the one who threw those kids in the dumpster.
What?!

Yeah, and I think we can both learn some valuable lessons from this. Like, I should be more careful what I do in front of Mrs. Irvine’s house. And you...well, you should be more careful who you lend your coat to. Rowley looks at him steadily for a moment.
You know what, you’re not a good friend.
Whoa, how can you even say that? I’m a great friend.
If you were a great friend you would've told Mr. Winsky the truth.
Okay, one thing, you can’t get mad about just --
You're always bossing me around. You weren’t happy I got the cartoon. You broke my hand and you didn’t even seem sorry!
That broken hand was the best thing that ever happened to you.
Don’t call me, don’t come by my house. We're done. (CONTINUED)
154 155 156 157 158 DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 76.
Rowley exits, leaving Greg alone in the empty school.
Kids are hanging out in the snowy front yard before the f bell. Greg watches Rowley who is deep in conversation wit Angie.

I thought the whole thing would blow over, but Rowley was still giving me the silent treatment, even when I tried to make the first move. GREG THROWS A SNOWBALL AT ROWLEY, it hits him on the back the head. Rowley turns around and Greg smiles and gives h a friendly wave. Rowley and Angie just glare at him and continue their conversation. INT. MR. WINSKY’S OFFICE - DAY 156 Greg and Rowley face Mr. Winsky who is holding Greg’s bad

Thanks to an anonymous tipster, I now know the whole story. Greg, you’re relieved of your Safety Patrol duties, effective immediately. (turns to Rowley) Rowley, for showing dignity under false suspicion, I’m promoting you to Team Captain. As Mr. Winsky hands Rowley a new, bigger badge, Greg look out the glass window of Mr. Winsky’s door. He sees Angie just outside the door watching.
Greg and Rowley exit Mr. Winsky’s office.
Hey, Cap’n, you’re still gonna hook me up with cocoa, right? Rowley ignores him and walks off with Angie. Greg watches them go.
They are in the frozen food aisle. Greg trails Susan who pushing Manny in the cart. (CONTINUED)
158 159 DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 77.
Should I get some more pizzas? Is Rowley coming over this weekend?
I don’t think so. We’re kind of on the outs.
Why? What happened?
Nothing. He got mad because I -- never mind.
Okay. She keeps moving down the aisle. At the end of the aisle a rack full of Valentine’s Day cards.
(taking a card) Maybe it would help if you made a gesture. Like, say, send hima card for Valentine’s day. They have friend ones. Greg is stunned by the awfulness of this idea.

Mom, you've had a lot of bad ideas. Band camp. Getting me and Rodrick matching jackets. The family canoe trip. But that, that’s the worst. Susan watches him walk away and doesn’t notice that Manny taken the card and started chewing on it. When she looks back, it’s all gummed up and slimy. Susan hurriedly puts back in the rack behind some other cards and moves away.

SUPER: “March. Thursday.” Much like the first day of school, Greg walks down the ha alone, surrounded by kids who pay no attention to him. He watches as Collin crosses to Rowley, carrying an overnigh bag.
Hey Rowley, my mom says it’s okay for me to sleep over tonight. (CONTINUED)
159 160 161 DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 78.
Awesome! Greg watches Rowley and Collin head off together.

The whole thing with Rowley is, I was willing to let bygones be bygones but then he made friends with Collin just to mess with me. As if I even care if he -- CRACK. INT. GREG’S ROOM - NIGHT 160 Greg is on his bed writing in his journal. He looks at hi pencil and realizes he’s broken the tip off from the fierceness of his writing. He flops back on his bed and stares at the ceiling.

Well you know what? Two can play at that game. EXT. ROWLEY’S STREET - DUSK 161 Rowley and Collin are playing in Rowley’s front yard. Gre carrying an overnight bag, walks super-casually past them the next house, where Fregley is playing alone in the fro yard. Rowley and Collin watch Greg pass, but nobody says word. Greg walks up to Fregley, who is stabbing a kite with a stick.
Hey Greg Heffley.
What’s happening, Fregley?
Killing a kite. Greg shoots a look toward Rowley and Collin. Rowley is watching Greg, but when he sees Greg look at him, he quic looks away.
I was thinking maybe you might want to have a sleepover. (CONTINUED)
161 162 DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 79.
Yeah. With who?
Me.
Yeah! When?
(losing patience) Now.
(jumping up and down) Alright! We're gonna be best friends forever!
Uh-huh. (loudly, for Rowley’s benefit) I can’t believe I was able to pencil you in for a sleepover, what with my busy schedule.
Greg Heffley, I love you!

(glancing at Rowley) Uh-huh, uh-huh, let’s just get inside. Greg shepherds Fregley toward his front door. INT. FREGLEY’S BEDROOM - LATER 162 Greg is at the window looking out. Fregley has set up a twister mat.

Hey, Greg Heffley, you wanna play twister? Do ya? Wanna? Twister? Greg looks at Fregley for a beat, then turns back to the window. FROM GREG'S POV we see that Rowley and Collin are still in Rowley’s yard.
You know what, Fregley, maybe this wasn’t such a good -- (CONTINUED)
162 163 164 DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 80.
Greg turns and sees Fregley has gone through his overnigh bag and pulled out a A BAG OF JELLYBEANS which he is feverishly stuffing into his mouth.
Hey!

I’m not supposed to have sugar. Not even a little. My mom says it makes me cr-aaa-zzz-yyyy! (maniacal laugh) Hahahahahahaha! Fregley empties the rest of the bag into his mouth. INT. FREGLEY’S BEDROOM - MOMENTS LATER 163 Greg is backed as far into the corner as he can go. Alarm he watches Fregley twitch and dance. Fregley leaps up ont his bed.
He fixes his eyes on Greg. FREGLEY (CONT’D) I will destroy you, Lex Luthor! Suddenly, he makes a flying leap at Greg who dodges out o the way.
(calls for help) Hey, Mrs....uh, Fregley?! Hello??? Is anybody there?? Fregley jumps to his feet and faces Greg.

Fregley charges Greg. Greg makes for the door. He throws the door open and runs out with Fregley in hot pursuit. INT. FREGLEY’S HALLWAY - CONTINUOUS 164 Greg races down the hall. He doesn’t know where he’s heading. (CONTINUED)

Fregley is right behind him, chasing him with his index finger outstretched. Greg spots an open door at the end o the hall. The bathroom. He races inside and slams the doo behind him, locking it.
Greg catches his breath. We hear LOUD THUMPING SOUNDS as Fregley throws his body against the door.

Greg, traumatized, sits in a little ball on the floor. It quiet. No sound from Fregley. Then a PIECE OF PAPER slide under the door. Greg gingerly crosses to it, picks it up reads it. The letter reads: “DEAR GREG HEFFLEY, I’M VERY SORRY I CH

text: SO YOU CAN GET ME BACK.” At the bottom of the page is an arrow that points directl where Greg’s thumb is. Greg moves his thumb. JUST UNDERNEATH WHERE HIS THUMB HAD BEEN IS A BOOGER. Greg sta to sway gently as his head swims with the horror. As he starts to topple over... THE SCREEN GOES BLACK.
The cheese is alone on the deserted sport court, surround by grimy old snow.
You know, to be honest I’m a lot better off without friends. All friends do is drag you down and suck the life out of you.
Greg parks his bike in the bike rack, next to Rowley’s Bi Wheel.

Rowley’s been nothing but a distraction. Now that I’m on my own and don't have to worry about carrying around all that dead weight, I can get back to the business of making a name for myself.  169 170 171 172 DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 82.

Greg is on stage in Shakespearean garb and with long, art hair, taking his bows in front of an audience of kids. Th are really going crazy for him. Rowley is in the audience too. He is so amazed by Greg’s performance, he can’t help but stand up and join the adulation.
A full page photo of Greg in his drama get-up. Underneath the caption “Most Talented”.

A bunch of kids are gathered in the audience seats. A gro of six kids, including Greg and Patty Farrell, are groupe around the piano on the stage. The drama teacher, MRS. NORTON, sits at the piano. Coach Malone, clearly assigned against his will, is there to assist.
Greg Heffley, step forward. Mrs. Norton plays the opening bars of “My Country ‘Tis Of Thee.” GREG BEGINS TO SING IN A SURPRISINGLY CLEAR AND PU SOPRANO.
(singing) My country ‘tis of thee/sweet land of liberty/of thee I sing... Mrs. Norton is so surprised she stops playing.
That was...that was very good, Greg. One moment please. She huddles with Coach Malone. (CONTINUED)

MRS. NORTON (CONT’D) He has amazing tone. I wonder if he...could play Dorothy?
Well, if girls can wrestle I guess anything goes around here. Greg overhears this. So do some of the other kids, and th start laughing.

It's The Wizard of Oz and I’m going to be a tree.

Could be. But it won’t be. ‘Cause it’s lame.

No, really. This is a very proud moment and I just want to acknowledge that. We’re all so busy, we never take the time to tell each other stuff like that. I love you guys. Susan squeezes Rodrick’s hand. RODRICK BURPS LOUDLY. Fran and Greg start to laugh, then stop when they see the look Susan’s face.
Fine, I’m sorry I shared a feeling. (CONTINUED)

She gets up and angrily begins clearing dishes.
Honey. Come on. (then) Rodrick.

I’m fine. She’s not. She’s pissed. She exits. Frank looks at Rodrick.
I’m going to pay for that. He exits after Susan.
(to Greg) Way to wreck dinner, jerk.
Greg is being fitted for his tree outfit. Patty Farrell nearby practising some dance moves. As Mrs. Norton fits tube over Greg, he notices there are no arm holes.
Wait, we don’t get armholes? How are we going to throw apples at Dorothy without armholes?
Hold on, nobody's throwing anything at me. I was Annie in the Strasberg Camp for the Performing Arts production of “Annie.”
Nobody's throwing anything at anybody.

(to Greg) I changed the play a little bit and you won’t need armholes. 85. 175 176 is the (CONTINUED)

Greg and his fellow trees, ARCHIE KELLY and MARTY PORTER lined up on stage in their tree costumes, miserably singi Mrs. Norton places other kids, dressed as shrubs, around stage. She places RODNEY JAMES (Bush #2) right next to th trees.
We three trees from yonder glen/Do spy a maiden fair and sweet... Greg looks down and notices Rodney is playing a video gam hidden inside his bush costume. WE HEAR VIDEO GAME BEEPS.

...-Whilst we are rooted to our spots/She doth move on lighter feet./With her dog so small and true/We hope she fares well, indeed we do. The trees finish their song and start to wobble offstage, ARCHIE KELLY DOESN’T SEE RODNEY AND TAKES A HEADER RIGHT HIM. Because he has no arm holes, Archie can’t break his fall.
Aah, my tooth, I think I knocked out my tooth! Mrs. Norton rushes over and pulls Archie to his feet. As struggles to get him up...
(to Mrs. Norton) Guess we need arm holes after all. Mrs. Norton glares at Greg.

Patty as Dorothy and Chirag as her dog Toto are mid-scene (CONTINUED)

(as Dorothy) Come on, Toto, let’s explore this magical path! Chirag doesn’t move fast enough for Patty’s taste.

(snaps) I said come on! They move toward the other side of the stage and reach Th Trees. A SPOTLIGHT FINDS GREG AND THE REST OF THE TREES. Greg looks out into the audience and sees his whole famil Mom, Dad, Manny and Rodrick, who is filming him with a camcorder. Susan holds a bouquet of flowers.
Bubby! Manny’s word rings out in the auditorium. Greg looks out the crowd. Some of the kids in the audience laugh. CLOSE GREG as his eyes dart back and forth looking for a way ou this.

Huh? A LARGER LAUGH from the crowd.
(as Dorothy) What say you, Toto? Should we explore this intriguing yellow path?
(as Toto) Bow wow. Patty and Chirag exit to the wings. Mrs. Norton, sitting the side of the stage, plays the opening bars of “We Thre Trees.” The trees start to sing.
We three trees from yonder glen/Do spy a maiden fair and sweet. (CONTINUED)

Greg looks out into the audience and sees ROWLEY AND COLL Collin whispers something in Rowley’s ear and Rowley look Greg and giggles. GREG STOPS SINGING.

Whilst we are rooted to... Marty and Archie look at Greg questioningly. He just star back at them, eyes wide. His fear is contagious and their singing trails off... Mrs. Norton stops playing and stands up to see what’s goi on. Now there is silence. A long silence. Patty stands off-stage watching and getting angrier.
(desperate loud whisper) Whilst we are rooted to our spots, she doth move on lighter feet. The other trees look at Greg, but he just stares off into space. Patty is now hopping mad.
(angry whisper) Sing. Sing. (then loudly) Sing! A kid in the crowd (AUDIENCE KID) yells out amid the deafening silence.
This bites! It’s too much for Patty. She steps out onto the stage.
(screams ) You're not good at anything Greg Heffley! Greg looks at Patty with hate in his eyes. He looks down the apple on the stage floor, and then at his new armhole Screw it.

The other trees and Greg start pulling apples off their branches and pelting Patty as fast as they can. She retur fire just as rapidly. THE STAGE IS A HAIL OF APPLES. The audience is stunned into silence. Except for ANGIE. She i standing in the aisle and had been taking pictures, but i mesmerized by the action onstage she’s now simply watchin
Yeah! Susan is mortified. Rodrick is filming madly, trying to catch all the action. A nearby dad, who thinks he’s funny (FUNNY DAD) leans over to Frank.
(points to Greg) What’s the worst thing that kid could say to you? Frank shrugs.
"Hi, dad.” Funny Dad laughs at his own joke.
Yeah, heh heh, good one. Mrs. Norton has climbed the stage and is hurriedly CLOSIN THE CURTAIN. The last thing we see before the curtain shu is PATTY RUSHES GREG AND TACKLES HIM LIKE A LINEBACKER.

The audience is streaming out of the auditorium. Several families wait outside, congratulating/consoling their lit “stars.” The Heffleys are there, as is the FUNNY DAD from before. Greg walks up to them.
Hey, dad. Frank looks over at Funny Dad, sees him looking at them. Funny Dad quickly averts his eyes.

(holds up camera) I own you now. Susan throws her bouquet of flowers in the trash and stea out the door with Manny. Greg looks to his dad. Frank loo at Funny Dad, then puts his arm around Greg. (CONTINUED)

I thought Dorothy deserved it. Greg looks at him gratefully. They head out.

These days, I don’t feel much like doing anything. I don’t know why. Maybe I have lyme disease. Various kids run by, including Rowley and Collin, now wea MATCHING “BEST FRIENDS” T-SHIRTS. Greg sighs, looks sadly down at the cheese. He is completely alone.

head_text.subj: IN FAST MOTION, DIFFERENT GROUPS OF KIDS MOVE IN AND OUT
AROUND GREG, WHO REMAINS MOTIONLESS. THE SUN COMES OUT,

text: FLOWERS BLOOM. IT’S DEEP INTO SPRING WHEN TIME SLOWS DOWN AGAIN.
SUPER: “May. Thursday.” Greg watches his mother put dinner on the table. Manny is sitting at the table on his potty.
You know, I read this really interesting article.
(suspicious) You did?
Yeah. About home-schooling. It sounds pretty good.
What?
Yeah. It’s a scientific fact that kids who are home-schooled get a better education than kids at regular schools. (CONTINUED)

Susan looks at him a long beat.
Is this about Rowley?
What? No, I just care about my education.
No, you don’t. (then calls) Frank, Rodrick, dinner. Frank enters and sits at the table. He looks at Manny.
I just...what if he goes? What do we do then?
We celebrate his achievement.
(to Greg) Am I the only one who thinks this is weird? Rodrick joins them at the table and gleefully brandishes crumpled piece of paper.

Hey, little brother, look what I found in the trash. Guess you threw it away by accident. Panicked, Greg tries to grab the paper, but Rodrick holds over his head and hands it to Susan. RODRICK (CONT’D) It's the invitation for the Mother/Son Sweetheart Dance. Know you don’t want to miss that. (mocking) Phew. Lucky I found it. Greg glares at Rodrick; Rodrick grins back at him. (CONTINUED)

That was it; I was fed up. I'd been taking it from Rowley and taking it from Rodrick and taking it from everybody else. It was time for some payback.

The din of Loded Diaper rehearsing in the basement can be heard. Manny is sitting on his potty eating a snack at th table. Greg enters, carrying the girlie mag from Rodrick’ room (Moto Mamas) and a big Tootsie Roll. He crosses to Rodrick’s backpack which is on the chair next to Manny an unzips it.

Okay Manny, I’m putting this Tootsie Roll in Rodrick’s backpack. It’s for Rodrick, not you, so don’t take it. Manny watches as Greg slips the Tootsie Roll into the pag of Moto Mamas magazine and puts it in Rodrick’s backpack. Greg exits smiling.

Susan enters the kitchen with a basket full of laundry an stops cold when she sees Manny on the floor eating the Tootsie Roll and giggling at the picture of the bikini-cl girl straddling a motorcycle on Rodrick’s magazine.
Manny, where did you get that? Manny points to Rodrick’s backpack. At that moment Greg enters and innocently looks at the magazine.
Oh my goodness, that’s offensive.
Susan storms into the band’s rehearsal, followed by Greg is grinning and carrying Manny.
Rodrick, I need to talk to you. Upstairs, now.
Go ahead and talk. We’re a band, we have no secrets. (CONTINUED)

Fine. (brandishing magazine) What is this? Rodrick is immediately on the ropes.
It’s not mine.
It was in your backpack.
No, it was in my room. (realizes he said too much) Ohh. Rodrick slumps down. Greg can barely contain his glee.
Rodrick sits in a chair, Susan paces in front of him. His bandmates are lined up on the couch, enjoying the show. G is leaning against the wall, arms crossed, savoring every glorious moment.
Did owning this magazine make you a better person?
No. Rodrick tries to ignore his bandmates’ snickers.
Did it make you more popular at school?
Yes. (off Susan) No.
Do you have anything you want to say to women for having owned this offensive magazine? (CONTINUED)

(in agony) I’m sorry women. Rodrick’s bandmates burst into applause. He’s mortified.
You’re grounded. For two weeks. Rodrick shoots a glance at his bandmates. They look back him like, “Are you going to take that?” In a last ditch attempt to save face:
Okay, settle down. I think one week is plenty. Greg can’t believe Rodrick said that -- this is going bet than he ever dreamed.
Make it four weeks. And I’m going to need the keys to your van. All the blood drains from Rodrick’s face.
(a mortal blow) My van?
Do you have anymore smart comments? Silence from Rodrick.

Okay, practice is over. Rodrick, you can go to your room. Rodrick can’t even look his bandmates in the eye as they out. Susan grabs Manny from Greg and marches up the stair behind them. As Rodrick sullenly heads out he glances at Greg, who looks back at him perhaps a little too innocent Rodrick mouths the words “YOU'RE SO DEAD” at Greg as he passes. Greg watches him exit, elated. He throws his fists into t air in victory.
Yes! (CONTINUED)
187 188 DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 95.
He looks around, but realizes there’s no one there to sha the moment. His face falls, his arms slowly drop to his sides. He’s all alone.

The gym is dark, lit only by a disco ball. It’s about hal full of parents and kids. There is a DJ spinning records nobody dances. In fact, everybody seems pretty uncomforta and awkward. Greg and Susan enter. Greg looks grim, dress in a suit jacket and slacks. Susan is dressed up, seems excited. Greg looks around and sees lots of kids from his class. He passes Archie Kelly who is being hassled by Quentin and his friend ARTHUR.
Hey, Bubby.
Where’s your bubby now, Bubby? They laugh. Greg nervously puts some distance between him and Archie.
Look at this place! Wow, it’s like a real disco. Want to dance?
(aghast) God no. Just then, Rowley and Collin enter with THEIR MOMS. They look like they’re having a great time. Susan watches Greg who watches Rowley.
Okay, enough already. Just go talk to him, fix it.
I can't.
He’s your best friend. And sometimes, when somebody's worth it, you just have to put yourself out there. A beat.
I wouldn’t even know what to say. (CONTINUED)
188 DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 96.
Invite him out for ice cream after the dance. Everybody likes ice cream.
I guess that’s not your worst idea ever.
Stop, I’m blushing. But she’s really pleased Greg is taking her advice. Greg sees Rowley is at the refreshments table getting punch. H takes a deep breath and crosses to him.
Hey, Rowley.
Hey. A beat of silence. In the background, Susan cranes her he to get a better look.
So...you want to go get some ice cream after? Collin steps between them.
We already have plans.
(regretful) ...yeah, we do.
Fine. My mom wanted me to ask, so I did. Greg turns and heads back to Susan. As he approaches, she smiles at him expectantly.
Well? Greg just shakes his head “no.” Susan’s face falls.
Oh. Well...oh. At that moment a new song starts. (CONTINUED)

MUSIC CUE: “Groove Is In The Heart” by Deee-lite

text: START TO DANCE. But they don’t just dance. They doa routine that they have clearly practised many times -- it right out of “Dancing With The Stars”. The crowd watches, mouths agape. Greg is horrified.

I couldn't believe what I was seeing. This is just the kind of thing I could have saved Rowley from doing if we were still friends. But now this fool was about to get himself killed. BUT THE CROWD STARTS TO GET INTO IT. A group of people surrounds Rowley and his mom, clapping and cheering them Other people start streaming onto the dance floor and dancing. The party is kicked into high gear. Rowley is now part of a whole group of kids, including Shelly, Marley and Collin, who are trying to learn his da Greg does not know a curse word bad enough to express wha he’s feeling.
Greg is on the sport court, Rowley crosses to him. He has somewhat conciliatory air about him.
Hey. Greg senses a thaw in Rowley’s attitude.
Hey.
So...I left my racing game at your house and I’m having a sleepover so I need it back.
What? No way. Finder’s keepers.
You didn’t find it, I left it.
Fine, then leaver’s losers. (CONTINUED)
189 DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 98.
(getting heated) That’s not even a real thing.
It is if I say it is.
It’s my game!
You wouldn't even have that game if I hadn’t told you about it! You wouldn’t have half the stuff you have without me!
Yeah, like a broken hand!
That was a million years ago! Greg and Rowley are now shouting at each other. A CROWD, INCLUDING PATTY FARRELL, STARTS TO GATHER AROUND THEM. Gr and Rowley don’t notice.
It clicks now! (bending wrist) Hear that? Click click click click! And it’s all your fault!
It was an ACCIDENT!
Fight! Fight! The crowd joins in. The noise gets the attention of Angie who is nearby on the grass reading a book.
Fight! Fight! Fight! This stops Greg and Rowley cold. They look around at the shouting kids.
(louder) Fight! Fight! Greg and Rowley are stuck. Greg puts up his dukes. Rowley does the same, then starts hopping around. (CONTINUED)
189 190 DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 99,

It’s clear neither has the faintest idea how to fight. An joins the crowd as Greg and Rowley start to half-heartedl circle each other. Just then there is a loud SQUEAL OF BRAKES. THE TEENS’ PICKUP TRUCK HAS PULLED UP AT THE CURB. Pete, Chris, Carter and Wade hop out and head toward Greg and Rowley. THE CROWD SCATTERS AND RUNS BACK INTO THE SCHOOL. Angie finds a spot behind a tree and looks on. Greg and Rowley start to run but the teens are too fast a grab them.
Greg and Rowley are being held by Wade and Carter as Pete paces in front of them.
I waited a long time for this.
You’re so freakin’ dead. Greg doesn’t love what they’re saying. But he’s really freaked out by the fact that THE CHEESE IS ONLY A FEW FEE AWAY. In fact, as Pete paces, he’s walking right by it.
You have no idea what we’re going to do to you.
Oh yeah. Rowley, following Greg’s eye line, now sees the cheese an visibly blanches. Neither Greg nor Rowley can keep their eyes off it. Chris pulls Pete aside.
What are we gonna do?
Dunno. (CONTINUED)
190 DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 100.
We need to move this along. My shift at Applebee’s starts in like half an hour. Pete looks at Greg and Rowley...then he looks at what the looking at. Pete crosses to the cheese.
(re: Rowley) Gimme the wide one. Carter hustles Rowley over to Pete.
Pick it up.
But --
Pick it up! Rowley reluctantly picks up the cheese. He holds it by th tips of his fingers, totally grossed out.
Now eat it. Rowley’s eyes widen in horror. He starts to bring the che closer to his mouth. CLOSE ON GREG: Greg winces, closing his eyes to block out the horror of what he is seeing.

I don’t even want to say exactly what happened because if Rowley ever tries to run for President and someone finds out what these guys made him do, he won’t have a chance. So I’1l just put it this way. They made Rowley BLANK the cheese. Angie covers her eyes, aghast. Pete looks over at Greg.
Now you. Wade hustles Greg toward the cheese. Greg fights him the whole way. (CONTINUED)
190 DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 101.
But...but...I’m allergic to dairy. Wade just ignores him.

Hey! What are you doing on school property? The teens, Greg, and Rowley turn to see Coach Malone runn toward the sport court. Behind him, the kids from before trickle out of the school and cautiously begin to follow. Greg turns quickly to Rowley who is so traumatized by eat the cheese he seems to be having an out-of-body experienc COACH MALONE (CONT’D) Pete Hosey is that you? THE TEENS RUN TO THEIR TRUCK, JUMP IN AND PEEL OUT. With satisfied nod, Coach Malone hitches up his shorts and hea back inside. The rest of the kids regather around Greg an Rowley, including Angie.
What happened?
What’d they want?

What’d they do to you? Greg looks at Rowley who seems to be recovering slightly. Patty is near Rowley. She looks down at the place where t cheese used to be and sees that it’s gone. THERE IS A FAD OUTLINE OF WHERE THE CHEESE WAS. She looks around and see the cheese at Rowley’s feet. WITH A BIT OUT OF IT.
Oh. My. God. Everyone falls silent. As one, they all look down at the cheese. Then they all look at Rowley. Rowley locks eyes with Greg. It’s all too much for him, his eyes well up wi tears.
(to crowd) Rowley Jefferson ate -- At that moment, Greg steps forward and picks up the chees THE CROWD GASPS. (CONTINUED)
190 DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 102.
I ate the cheese. THE CROWD GASPS AGAIN. Rowley stares at Greg in wonder. Angie smiles.
Yeah. I ate it. And you know what, people? I just did you all a huge favor. Greg holds the cheese high, gathering steam.

I ate the cheese to show everyone how stupid this whole school is. The wrong friends, the wrong lunch table, the wrong butt, it’s all meaningless, just like this cheese. Anyone else who's sick of it, step forward and join me! Greg surveys the crowd confidently.
OVERHEAD SHOT: The crowd scatters like a bomb went off, leaving Greg and Rowley alone again. Except for Angie who gives Greg an approving look.
See you later, Heffley. She goes inside. Greg crosses to Rowley. They stand and look at each other Then:
So, you want to come over after school and...play? Rowley smiles.
Yeah. Okay. They head off together.  191 192 193 194 DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 103.
Greg walks down the hall with Rowley. Everybody gives the wide berth.
So now I officially have the Cheese Touch. But it’s not so bad. There are perks.
Greg stands with Coach Malone. Nearby are a bunch of kids cowboy hats and vests.
Since nobody’1l hold your hand, I guess you’re excused from square dancing.
Greg and Rowley’s way is blocked by Quentin who has his b to them.
Move!
What’d you say?! He turns around, ready to pound whoever said that. He see it’s Greg, shrinks away. Greg and Rowley pass by.
Greg and Rowley, carrying their lunch trays, cross to a t full of jocks.
Hey, fellas. He puts his tray on the table. Everyone at the table quic grabs their lunch trays and clears out. Greg, immensely pleased, smiles at Rowley.
After you. They happily sit down to a civilized lunch.  195 196 DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 104.

And I’m not the only one who had an exciting year. The Heffley family is eating breakfast. Manny is on the floor playing. Then he climbs up onto his potty. The fami watches; the air is thick with anticipation. Suddenly, TH SOUND OF PEE IN THE POTTY. Everybody cheers. Frank’s chee is half cheer, half wince.
SUPER: “June. Friday.” Greg, Rowley, and Angie are having lunch at their own tab PATTY APROACHES, HANDING OUT YEARBOOKS. She gives one to Angie.
Here’s your yearbook. You’re not in it that much, maybe try to get out there a little next year.
(gently) One day, Patty, middle school will end and become high school. And after that, it just becomes life. And all the things you think are important now, won’t be anymore.
(confused, thus snotty) You wish. Angie heads off. Patty hands a yearbook to Rowley. Greg holds out his hand.
As if. She puts Greg’s yearbook on the table.
Handing it to you is like touching you. And I’m way too smart to touch somebody who ate the cheese. She puts her hand on Rowley’s shoulder. (CONTINUED)
196 197 DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 105.
Right, Rowley?
Yep, you’re too smart for me, Patty. Rowley is trying really hard not to laugh. Patty sashays off. Greg and Rowley look at each other, then crack up.

Well, the yearbook was pretty much the Rowley Jefferson show. We see Rowley’s pictures are all over it. On the Safety Patrol page, the Wrestling Team page, in the candids sect holding up his arm in its cast.

And I don’t even want to talk about the Class Favorites page. We flip to the Class Favorites page and see ROWLEY HAS BE VOTED CLASS CLOWN. The yearbook closes. PULL BACK TO REVE GREG IS HOLDING THE BOOK, IN FRONT OF A WHITE BACKGROUND. Greg addresses the camera.
